content.text: Cambridge International Examinations are the cornerstone of academic credibility for Eduversal Partner Schools. Maintaining examination integrity, security, and fairness is a contractual requirement of our Cambridge Centre status and demonstrates our commitment to ethical assessment and international standards.

content.title: Key Objectives
items: Ensure secure, fair, and compliant administration of all Cambridge examinations.
Maintain Cambridge Centre status through adherence to regulations and annual declarations.
Protect candidate welfare and rights throughout the examination process.
Provide accurate, timely data to inform teaching, intervention, and university counseling.
Demonstrate assessment integrity to meet CIS/WASC accreditation standards.

content.title: Alignment with Organizational Frameworks
items: CIS Domain: Teaching & Assessing for Learning (Assessment Integrity)
WASC Category: B. Curriculum, Instruction, and Assessment; C. Support for Student Personal and Academic Growth
Cambridge: Centre Handbook compliance; Quality Management Standards
Indonesian Context: Integration with rapor (report cards); data reporting to Dapodik, where applicable.

content.text: Clear role delineation ensures accountability and prevents gaps in examination management.

items.title: Principal
resp: Sign and submit the Cambridge Centre Annual Declaration by the deadline.
Approve examination entries, timetable clashes, and special consideration requests.
Ensure adequate secure storage facilities and monitor key control logs.
Authorize appointment of the Exams Officer and Quality Nominee.
Oversee investigations of malpractice or maladministration and communicate with Cambridge.
Review post-results analysis and integrate findings into the School Improvement Plan (SIP).
Allocate budget for examination fees, invigilation costs, and contingency arrangements.
Report examination outcomes to the Board and integrate data into EduNav dashboards.

items.title: Exams Officer
resp: Manage the examination entry process: verify student eligibility, submit entries via Cambridge International Direct (CID), and confirm fee payments.
Create and publish the internal examination timetable, resolving timetable clashes.
Coordinate access arrangements with the Learning Support Team.
Order and receive question papers and materials per the Cambridge Key Times schedule.
Conduct secure storage audits and maintain control logs for all materials.
Train and brief invigilators using standardized checklists.
Prepare examination rooms and ensure compliance with Cambridge regulations.

items.title: Invigilators
resp: Arrive early to collect materials and verify room setup.
Read the Examination Instructions to Candidates script verbatim.
Monitor candidate behavior continuously and document any irregularities.
Assist candidates with permitted queries without providing subject-specific help.
Enforce prohibited items policy and ensure silence and fairness throughout the session.

items.title: Quality Nominee
resp: Liaise with Cambridge on Centre inspections or audits.
Lead internal quality assurance reviews.
Ensure syllabus changes and assessment updates are communicated to teaching staff.
Support the Principal and Exams Officer during malpractice investigations.

content.text: Cambridge examination materials must be stored in conditions that prevent unauthorized access, tampering, or environmental damage.

content.title: Secure Storage Requirements
items: Dedicated secure room or cabinet with steel construction and dual locks.
Environmental controls: Temperature 15-25Â°C, humidity <70%, fire suppression system.
Access restrictions: Only the Principal and Exams Officer hold keys.

steps.title: Materials Receipt Process
steps.desc: Verify the courier's identity, inspect packages for tampering, log receipt in the Secure Storage Register, and store immediately.

steps.title: Materials Dispatch Process
steps.desc: Pack scripts securely, complete dispatch documentation, photograph sealed packages, and use a tracked courier service.

steps.title: Confirm room bookings and display 'EXAM IN PROGRESS' signage.
steps.desc: Prepare seating plans and set up examination desks with minimum spacing.

steps.title: Verify clock synchronization and test environmental conditions.
steps.desc: Place candidate instructions posters and prepare invigilator packs.

steps.title: Opening the Exam
steps.desc: Invigilators arrive, candidates are admitted, identity checks are conducted, and prohibited items are confiscated.

steps.title: During the Exam
steps.desc: Continuous vigilance is maintained, and any irregularities are documented.

steps.title: Closing the Exam
steps.desc: Collect all materials systematically, count scripts against the attendance register, and dismiss candidates row by row.

steps.title: Different Start Times (Supervised Rest Break)
steps.desc: The candidate sits Exam A at the normal time, supervised for a rest break, then sits Exam B.

steps.title: Same Start Time (Separate Room)
steps.desc: The candidate takes both exams simultaneously in a separate room with an additional invigilator.

steps.title: Incident Report Form
steps.desc: Complete within 24 hours, documenting evidence and submitting to the Exams Officer.

steps.title: Communication with Cambridge
steps.desc: Report incidents and follow guidance for special consideration.

content.text: Malpractice undermines the integrity of the examination, while maladministration compromises examination security or fairness.

content.title: Definitions
items: Malpractice: Cheating, unauthorized materials, disruptive behavior, impersonation.
Maladministration: Opening papers early, providing unauthorized assistance, failing to report malpractice.

steps.title: Incident Report
steps.desc: Complete and submit to Exams Officer and Principal.

steps.title: Preliminary Review
steps.desc: Review evidence and determine if further investigation is needed.

steps.title: Candidate Interview
steps.desc: Invite candidate and parent to discuss the incident.

steps.title: Decision and Report to Cambridge
steps.desc: Determine if malpractice occurred and report findings.

steps.title: Communication and Record Keeping
steps.desc: Inform candidate of the outcome and file all documentation.

content.text: Access arrangements provide pre-exam support to candidates with documented learning needs.

content.title: Common Access Arrangements
items: Extra time (typically 25% additional)
Separate invigilation in a smaller room
Reader or scribe support
Modified question papers
Rest breaks
Word processor use

steps.title: Identify eligible candidates
steps.desc: Based on diagnostic assessments or medical documentation.

steps.title: Submit application to Cambridge
steps.desc: By the March deadline.

steps.title: Receive approval from Cambridge
steps.desc: Or proceed with Centre-approved arrangements.

steps.title: Inform Exams Officer
steps.desc: To arrange room setup and materials.

content.text: Special consideration provides post-exam grade adjustments for candidates affected by temporary circumstances.

content.title: Eligibility Criteria for Special Consideration
items: Candidate was present and completed the exam.
Adverse circumstances were beyond the candidate's control.
Evidence is available and submitted within 7 days of the exam.

steps.title: Report adverse circumstances
steps.desc: To the Exams Officer within 24 hours.

steps.title: Collect evidence
steps.desc: Medical certificate or incident report.

steps.title: Submit request via CID
steps.desc: Within 7 days of the exam.

steps.title: Cambridge reviews evidence
steps.desc: And may apply a percentage adjustment.

steps.title: Inform candidate of outcome
steps.desc: When results are released.

steps.title: Data Collection
steps.desc: Download results from Cambridge International Direct and upload to EduNav.

steps.title: Subject-Level Analysis
steps.desc: Heads of Department receive Subject Performance Reports.

steps.title: Cohort-Level Analysis
steps.desc: Senior Leadership Team reviews Whole-School Performance Dashboard.

steps.title: Integration into School Improvement Plan
steps.desc: Action planning meetings with Heads of Department.

steps.title: Clerical Re-Check
steps.desc: Verify that all parts of the script were marked correctly.

steps.title: Review of Marking
steps.desc: Re-mark by a senior examiner to check for marking errors.

steps.title: Return of Candidate Script
steps.desc: Obtain a copy of the candidate's marked script for review.

steps.title: Certificate Issuance
steps.desc: Verify certificate accuracy against results data.

steps.title: Lost or Duplicate Certificates
steps.desc: Complete Lost Certificate Request Form for duplicates.

steps.title: Record Retention
steps.desc: Maintain permanent digital archive of results and certificates.

content.text: In the event of a significant disruption, the Examinations Business Continuity Plan ensures minimal disruption to candidate welfare and qualification outcomes.

content.title: Key Elements
items: Communication Tree for rapid notification.
Alternative Venues pre-arranged.
Remote Invigilation procedures.
Predicted Grades Submission for internal assessment data.

steps.title: Data Review
steps.desc: Analyze results trends and post-results service outcomes.

steps.title: Stakeholder Feedback
steps.desc: Conduct surveys of candidates, invigilators, and subject teachers.

steps.title: Incident Analysis
steps.desc: Review all incident reports and malpractice cases.

steps.title: Compliance Audit
steps.desc: Self-assess against Cambridge Centre Handbook requirements.

steps.title: Action Planning
steps.desc: Identify improvements for the next series.

content.text: Cambridge may conduct inspections to verify Centre compliance.
Clear and timely communication reduces anxiety and ensures candidates are well-prepared for their examinations.

content.title: Communication Principles
items: Bilingual communications in English and Bahasa Indonesia.
Accessible language and visual aids.
Multi-channel communication methods.
Transparent about timelines and costs.

content.text: Cambridge charges fees per subject per candidate, with costs varying by qualification level and series.

content.title: Typical Fee Ranges (2025-26 Academic Year)
items: Cambridge Checkpoint: $30-50 per subject
IGCSE: $100-150 per subject
AS Level: $120-180 per subject
A Level: $150-220 per subject

content.text: Effective Cambridge examinations management is a hallmark of a high-performing international school. By adhering to the procedures, standards, and safeguards outlined in this section, Eduversal Partner Schools demonstrate commitment to examination integrity and fairness.
